parse: Hebrew Word
str2: Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

parse: Hebrew Word
str2: Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.

parse: Conjunction
str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Intrans: I lament, wail; trans: I bewail. From threnos; to bewail.

parse: Conjunction
str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Article - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Noun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To pain, grieve, vex. From lupe; to distress; reflexively or passively, to be sad.

parse: Conjunction
str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Noun - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: Pain, grief, sorrow, affliction. Apparently a primary word; sadness.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Preposition
str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Noun - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.
